name: Events
description:
This is a collection of our events.
We host first-time Co-Lab user events called First Fridays which are held on the first Friday of each month during the academic year. These events are come as you are, with no previous skills needed to participate. 
We also host Open House events which introduce users to various facets of the Co-Lab.
Ladies' Night is a women-only event which introduces users to various facets of the Co-Lab.

name: Python Software Development
description: Learn all about Python with this track, starting with an introduction and working your way up to using Django.

name: Machine Learning and Data Science
description: Learn how to use machine learning to analyze data and identify patterns.

name: Programming Fundamentals
description: Learn the fundamentals of programming before tackling a language.

name: System and Dev Ops
description: Learn about Linux and Bash, Docker, and virtual machines.

name: Databases
description: What exactly is SQL and how do you use it? This track covers all of that and more.

name: E-Textiles
description: Fashion meets technology. Learn how to create clothing that lights up!

name: Hardware
description: Before software developing, we need hardware! Come learn about the hardware that makes our world possible.

name: 3D Modeling
description: Come learn about 3C modeling, from modeling by hand using 3D pens to making your own furniture using CNC.

name: Sewing Basics
description: We can do all kinds of things with needles. Come learn how to sew with us and see what you can make!

name: Embroidery Basics
description: Come learn more about needle art!

name: One-Off Fun
description: Not everything fits into a nice little box, and we like it that way! Come take a break from your studies and join us for some good, clean (or very messy) fun!

name: Laser Cutting
description: Lasers. We can do all kinds of magic with them, from making cats bounce off walls to levitating objects (!!!). Sadly, we will not be doing either of these things, but we will be doing something just as fun: cutting things with lasers.

name: Casting
description: Casting is the process of using a mold to make something liquid into that shape. Think: pouring cake batter into a train shaped cake pan. In this track, you will learn how to cast with different materials and how to make your own molds.

name: User Experience (UX) & User Interface (UI)
description: Learn about the importance of user experience and user interface in web and application design. From the discovery phase to research to creating a project sketch and user testing, we walk you through the entire process so you can make sure your prototype is the best version of itself possible.

name: Research Computing- Data Visualization
description:
Whether you are a researcher looking to learn how to better display your data, or anyone wanting to learn more about computing resources at Duke, you may want to check out this track’s offerings! Dive into our Shiny series and impress your peers!
This track is a product of collaboration with Duke Research Computing, and works nicely as a supplement to the Data and Visualizations workshops offered by the library!

name: Research Computing- Duke Systems
description: Duke-specific research computing track. Learn about the Duke Computer Cluster and containers.

name: Gaming Development
description: Check out our Gaming Development track and get started on your journey to creating and coding for games! Get some knowledge about Unity and C# and game away!

name: Intro to VR
description: A whole new world! Check out our VR track and get transported to a new reality with VR!

name: Systems and Security
description: The objective of system security is the protection of information and property from theft, corruption and other types of damage, while allowing the information and property to remain accessible and productive. System security includes the development and implementation of security countermeasures.

name: Illustrator
description: Whether you have never opened Illustrator before or you haven’t seen its interface in a long time, this class is a great introduction to the program. This workshop will familiarize you with the different tools that you can later use to create anything from logos, to flyers, to convert rasters into vectors and so on.

name: InDesign
description: If you've never seen Adobe InDesign and want to get more familiar with the tools before taking another Roots workshop about creating with InDesign, complete this track. We will also go over how to create a document layout and get some practice with different projects.

name: Creating a Website
description: If you have always wanted to create a nice looking website to display some information about you or something you care about, this is the track for you! Whether you are a complete beginner or you have already made a few web pages, you should find something new to learn here. This track concentrates on Front End development (HTML/CSS/JavaScript) which is, in basic terms, what the users see when they load up your site. Take on our Create a Website classes if you are just starting and code your very first website, while learning the various concepts and features of the web languages, or look into our CSS Deep Dives for more advanced learning opportunities!

name: All About CSS for the Web
description: So you have created an HTML file, and it holds all your content, but it's lacking inspiration. It is time to add color to your world! In this second class in our Create a Website series, we are introducing a new language: CSS. CSS is the styling language for the web and it can make "most" of our web styling related dreams come true! With that said, CSS is a vast language with loads of possibilities and just like with everything, we must start small to one day go big.

name: All about JavaScript
description: JavaScript is not only the coffee order you've been rehearsing in your head so that you can quickly tell the barista your order, it's also a programming language that can make web pages interactive. It can animate images, control multimedia, and improves your users' interaction with your web page.

name: Create a No Code Website
description: Want to create a website to show off your work, but don't have the technical skills to do so? Learn how to create a website without having to code!

name: Co-Lab Machines
description: Want to start creating someting but not really sure how to use the tools in the makerspace? This track focuses on tutorials for how to use our machines.

name: Introduction to Data Science with R
description:
In this pathway, you will learn how to use the R programming language to perform exploratory data analysis and visualization. 
Each module is designed for beginners with little to no prior experience in R or data science. By the end of this pathway, you will have the foundational knowledge and skills needed to start using R for data science and continue to develop your skills in this field. If you're ready to take the first step in your data science journey and learn R, let's get started!

name: Printmaking
description: Learn how to make prints.

name: Sewing and Embroidery
description: Needle and thread can make anything beautiful. Learn how to sew and embroider!

name: Physical Computing
description: Thanks to Raspberry Pi's, Arduino's and the "Internet of Things", computing is no longer constrained to just touchscreens, keyboards, and mice. From robotics to data collection devices, learn the basics of using embedded devices and microcontrollers to create interactive experiences and control the physical world.

name: Code+
description: Pathway for all Co-Lab Code+ Training

name: Computational Reproducibility
description:
Welcome to a comprehensive course on Computational Reproducibility in Data Science! In today's rapidly evolving research landscape, the importance of transparent and reproducible research practices cannot be overstated. This course is designed to equip you with the knowledge and skills necessary to ensure the integrity of your data science projects through every stage of research. By combining three essential modules, this course empowers you to create a robust and transparent research environment. 

By the end of this course you will be able to: 

1. Engage with the topic of reproducibility and its impact on research and scholarly inquiry.
2. Identify tools and resources that you can use to support reproducible research practices.
3. Practice setting up a data science workflow using R and Git.
